intro: Spyridium stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spyridium, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and rocky soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms. Spyridium stenophyllum is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
